findings.title: Suggested ExecutorAdd Event in Constructor()
findings.description: The AngryContract contract lacks emitting important events that reflect state changes, specifically when the very first member of executorList is being added.

findings.title: Possible Sandwich/MEV For Reduced Purchase Price
findings.description: The purchase price can be arbitrarily manipulated due to lack of restriction on querying trading price of UniswapV2, making it vulnerable to possible sandwich attacks.

findings.title: Suggested Adherence Of Checks-Effects-Interactions Pattern
findings.description: The principle is effective in mitigating a serious attack vector known as `re-entrancy`. Via this particular attack vector, a malicious contract can be reentering a vulnerable contract in a nested manner.

findings.title: Improved Sanity Checks For System Parameters
findings.description: DeFi protocols typically have a number of system- wide parameters that can be dynamically configured on demand.

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: In AngryContract, there is a privileged owner account that plays a critical role in governing and regulating protocol-wide operations.
